summary: The "planning of the school year" is a crucial aspect of the organisation of teaching within the EU educational framework. This concept encompasses the systematic scheduling of academic activities, including term dates, holidays, and examination periods, to ensure a coherent and effective learning environment. EU regulations advocate for harmonised approaches to educational planning, promoting inclusivity and accessibility. By establishing clear guidelines, member states can enhance educational quality and facilitate cross-border cooperation in teaching methodologies. The planning of the school year is essential for aligning educational objectives with broader EU goals, fostering a unified educational landscape across diverse jurisdictions.
